alert.note: Alert for Dickens; King (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 6:04AM CDT until June 03 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Dickens and King Counties. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including standing water on area roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. The West Texas Mesonet near Spur measured 2.31 inches of rain. Radar indicates similar rainfall amounts between McAdoo and Afton, and also in southern King County. - Additional rainfall of 0.25 to 1 inch is likely over the area through 8 AM. This additional rain will prolong minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spur, Dickens, Guthrie, Dumont, Finney, Grow, Afton and Mcadoo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
